labels.analysis: The Currents API News Search Server focuses on providing advanced news search capabilities with robust filtering options (multi-language, category, date range, geographic filtering) and real-time news updates. It emphasizes efficient API usage through smart caching and rate limit handling. The available tool, "Optional Settings," allows users to manage server access by signing in, indicating some level of user authentication or management.
labels.reasoning: The primary function is news search and retrieval, clearly fitting under "Web Search & Research." The real-time updates and filtering suggest advanced information gathering capabilities. The mentioned smart caching and rate limit management are technical optimizations for API usage but do not shift the primary use case. No unique functionality warrants a custom label beyond predefined categories.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Currents API News Search Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Abdirashid-dv/currents_mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide advanced news search and retrieval with multi-language, category, date range, and geographic filtering. Access real-time news updates and comprehensive news data through a powerful set of tools and information resources. Optimize API usage with smart caching and handle rate limits gracefully.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Abdirashid-dv/currents_mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: apiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Get your free API key from https://currentsapi.services/signup/free
